Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery oil-vessel, interior grooved, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and with faint traces of black-painted hieratic word - 'oil'.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:21-22/568 Main City
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I:164 Pl. LXIII, fig. Q
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393126) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393126)
